video_description: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer Review - Detailed review of the new ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 based on the NVIDIA Tegra 2 platform. For more tablet and netbook reviews check out http://www.netbooknews.com

comments.author: zehzitow

comments.text:
It's completely your call.  The iPad is more expensive and has a very 'simple' GUI--personally, walsl of tiles annoy me.  Android is much more dynamic and customizable.  However, the iPad has more apps and lighter weight.  The Transformer can transform into a pseudo-netbook with the keyboard dock which the iPad can't do, as well as support usb ports through the dock.  The iPad doesn't.

There's no way to draw a definitive which-is-better line,﻿ it's entirely dependent on you.
